title: Prompt intent map: best / vs / alternatives / policy
content:
Prompt intent map: best / vs / alternatives / policy

Group the questions AI will answer and map them to target pages.

Learning goal

  • List 30–40 prompts by intent.
  • Map each prompt to a target page.

Why it matters

  • AI answers typical shopper questions; you must know where to send them.
  • Without intents, content and measurement are random.

Explanation

  • Best: “best [X] 2025 in [country]”.
  • Vs: “[X] vs [Y], which is better?”.
  • Alternatives: “What to buy instead of [X]?”.
  • Policy/fit: sizing, shipping, returns.

Examples

  • Good: Intent → page/capsule → measurement.
  • Poor: Random prompts with no target page.

Guided exercise (10–15 min)

  1. Create a table: Intent | Prompt | Target (PDP/collection/guide) | Notes.
  2. Fill 20 prompts (mix best/vs/alternatives/policy).

Independent exercise (5–10 min)

Expand to 30–40 prompts and prioritize A/B/C.

Self-check

  • Intent map with 30+ prompts.
  • Each prompt has a target page.
  • Priorities set.

Optional deepening

  • OpenAI prompt guide: https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/prompt-engineering
